verses.text: When all these things happen to you—the blessing and the curse that I have set before you—and you call them to mind among all the nations where the LORD your God has driven you,
verses.comment: Reflects on the prior chapters' blessings and curses and exile theme.

verses.text: and you return to the LORD your God and obey His voice, you and your children, with all your heart and with all your soul, according to all that I command you today,
verses.comment: Emphasizes total devotion and turning back in exile.

verses.text: then the LORD your God will restore your fortunes and have compassion on you, and He will gather you again from all the peoples where He has scattered you.
verses.comment: ‘Restore your fortunes’ reflects the Hebrew idiom ‘turn captivity’, meaning restoration from exile.

verses.text: Even if you are driven to the farthest parts under heaven, from there the LORD your God will gather you and from there He will take you.
verses.comment: ‘Farthest parts under heaven’ means the ends of the earth, accentuating God’s ability to restore.

verses.text: And the LORD your God will bring you into the land that your fathers possessed, and you shall possess it; and He will make you more prosperous and numerous than your fathers.
verses.comment: Restoration includes both return to land and greater blessing.

verses.text: And the LORD your God will circumcise your heart and the heart of your descendants, so that you love the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul, so that you may live.
verses.comment: ‘Circumcise your heart’ is a metaphor for spiritual renewal and inner transformation.

verses.text: And the LORD your God will put all these curses on your enemies and on those who hate you, who persecuted you.
verses.comment: The reversal of curse from Israel to their enemies.

verses.text: And you will again obey the voice of the LORD and do all His commandments that I command you today.
verses.comment: Renewal of covenant obedience.

verses.text: And the LORD your God will make you prosper abundantly in all the work of your hands, in the fruit of your womb, in the offspring of your livestock, and in your crops of the land. For the LORD will again delight in your prosperity, as He delighted in that of your fathers,
verses.comment: Blessings parallel earlier promise in Deuteronomy.

verses.text: if you obey the voice of the LORD your God, keeping His commandments and His statutes that are written in this Book of the Law, when you turn to the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.comment: Blessing is conditional on obedience and wholehearted devotion.

verses.text: For this commandment that I command you today is not too difficult for you, nor is it far off.
verses.comment: The law is accessible, not impossible.

verses.text: It is not in heaven, that you should say, ‘Who will go up for us to heaven and bring it to us, that we may hear it and do it?’
verses.comment: Quoted in Romans 10 about Christ; means God's word is available.

verses.text: Nor is it beyond the sea, that you should say, ‘Who will cross over the sea for us and bring it to us, that we may hear it and do it?’
verses.comment: The command is not inaccessible or hidden.

verses.text: But the word is very near you; it is in your mouth and in your heart, so that you may do it.
verses.comment: Accessibility of God’s law; quoted by Paul in Romans.

verses.text: See, I have set before you today life and good, death and evil.
verses.comment: The choice Moses sets before Israel.

verses.text: If you obey the commandments of the LORD your God that I command you today, by loving the LORD your God, walking in His ways, and keeping His commandments and His statutes and His judgments, then you will live and multiply, and the LORD your God will bless you in the land where you are going to possess.
verses.comment: Conditional blessing articulated clearly.

verses.text: But if your heart turns away and you do not listen, and you are drawn away to worship other gods and serve them,
verses.comment: Warning about idolatry and apostasy.

verses.text: I declare to you today that you will surely perish. You shall not live long in the land which you are crossing the Jordan to enter and possess.
verses.comment: Explicit statement of consequences for disobedience.

verses.text: I call heaven and earth as witnesses against you today, that I have set before you life and death, blessing and curse. Therefore choose life, so that you and your descendants may live,
verses.comment: 'Heaven and earth as witnesses' is a legal phrase signifying the seriousness of the covenant.

verses.text: by loving the LORD your God, obeying His voice, and holding fast to Him. For He is your life and the length of your days, so that you may dwell in the land that the LORD swore to give to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
verses.comment: Promise restated as rooted in the covenant with the Patriarchs.
